titleStmt.title: [Letter] 1832 Mar. 5 [to] Edward Livingston, Secretary of State / Andrew Jackson : a machine-readable transcription of an image
titleStmt.author: Jackson, Andrew

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Special Collections Library, University of Tennessee, Knoxville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text.

bibl.title: [Letter] 1832 Mar. 5 [to] Edward Livingston, Secretary of State / Andrew Jackson
bibl.author: Jackson, Andrew
bibl.note: This document is a letter dated March 5, 1832, from President Andrew Jackson to Edward Livingston, Secretary of State. Jackson writes to recommend Robert Beal to fill an open position in the Patent office.

projectDesc.p: Prepared for The University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.p: I am this moment informed, that the joint Resolution of the too Houses of Congress, giving five additional clerks to the patent office has been passed.
Young Mr Ebenezer Herone who filled the office in that Department to which Mr Walker was appointed, has the promise to fill one of them, and will be appointed.

Mr. Robert Beal the bearer hereof, has been well recommended, holds a letter from Commander Porter that would do honor to any man, is an excellent clerk, and lawyer by profession. I will be gratified that he fill another of them he has been a uniform faithful friend.

p.add:
Jackson, Andrew
(to Edw. Livingston
Sec. of State
March 5' 32
recommending Robt. Beale for employment in Patent office.
